meanings.definition: It was necessary or proper for someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: It behoved him to study for the test.
meanings.sent2: It behoved her to apologize for her mistake.
meanings.sent3: It behoved the cat to chase the mouse, but it just yawned instead.
meanings.sent4: The sun behoved to rise each morning, bringing light to the world.
meanings.sent5: The knight felt it behoved him to protect the kingdom from the dragon.

meanings.definition: It was a duty or responsibility for someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The behoved of a student is to learn and grow.
meanings.sent2: It is the behoved of a parent to care for their child.
meanings.sent3: The behoved of the clown was to make people laugh, but he kept tripping instead.
meanings.sent4: The behoved of the tree is to provide shade and oxygen for all creatures.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the behoved of the hero was to save the princess from the evil sorcerer.
